thread.title: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals, with Cueto, Ventura, Young to follow
thread.title_full: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals, with Cueto, Ventura, Young to follow - Winnipeg Free Press

author: Dave Skretta, The Associated Press
title: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals, with Cueto, Ventura, Young to follow
text:
KANSAS CITY, Mo. - Edinson Volquez will start the World Series opener for Kansas City, followed by Johnny Cueto in Game 2.
Yordano Ventura will start Game 3 at Citi Field on Friday, followed by Chris Young in Game 4.

Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Edinson Volquez pitches to the Toronto Blue Jays during first inning game 5 American League Championship Series baseball action in Toronto on Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. Volquez will start the World Series opener for Kansas City, followed by Johnny Cueto in Game 2. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Nathan Denette 
New York's rotation opens with Matt Harvey, and Jacob deGrom, Noah Syndergaard and Steven Matz follow.
Volquez was 13-9 with a 3.55 ERA during the regular season and 1-2 with a 4.32 ERA during three starts in the playoffs.
